newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Notionnel to try to rebound, target 128.80.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Notionnel to try to rebound, target 128.80.

text.p: June notionnel futures on the MATIF should begin to form a short term base around 128.20 on Monday, and may be capable of a slight bounce from there towards 128.80, technical analysts said.
But holidays in the UK and the U.S. mean trade will likely be thin, reducing the chances of any upside move.

"The June contract in my opinion should form a good base around 128.20 and we should see a nice rebound to 128.80, 129.00 before attempting further losses," said Christian Bado, senior technical analyst at Ferrier Lullin in Geneva.

By 0842 GMT, the June notionnel was down 46 basis points at 128.54, knocked by the first round of French parliamentary elections in which the combined left outpolled the centre-right. The contract hit an earlier low of 128.22.
Bado suggested selling the contract around the 128.80, 129.00 level as the market would soon fall back again.
He said on a one to two week view, the contract would try to move down towards 127.10, the full retracement of the upmove from April to mid May.
Dominique Barbet from Paribas in Paris also put support for the market at 128.20 and another one at 128.00.
"The level in notionnel should be pretty stable now, especially given the market in London is closed so there's no impetus from there," he said.

Barbet said the market may rebound to 128.68 at the most. "But that may need some kind of improvement in Germany and with the UK and the U.S. closed, there's little chance of that happening," he said.
By 0846 GMT, June Pibor was down 17 basis points at 96.30. One European analyst said such a move below 96.45, the low on Friday, signalled a failure of strength and a possible retest of further lows.
